feature.name: Adventure Rupes
feature.origin: English; one of Cook's ships on second voyage to the Pacific, 1772-75.

feature.name: Ahmad Baba
feature.origin: Abu-a;-Abbas Aj,Ad Obm Aj,Ad a;-Takruri Al-Massufi; Sudanese writer (1556-1627).

feature.name: Alvin Rupes
feature.origin: American; U.S.Navy's first deep submergence research vessel commissioned in 1964, designed specifically for oceanographic research.

feature.name: Antoniadi Dorsum
feature.origin: Eugene M.; Greco-French astronomer, defined classical nomenclature for albedo features of Mars (1870-1944).

feature.name: Anyte
feature.origin: Anyte of Tegea, Greek poet (early 3rd centrury BC).

feature.name: Apārangi Planitia
feature.origin: Māori word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Apollodorus
feature.origin: Apollodorus of Damascus; Greek architect (2nd century AD).

feature.name: Apollonia
feature.origin: Albedo name for unimaged H-5 region.

feature.name: Aristoxenus
feature.origin: Greek philosopher and musical theorist (fl. 4th century B.C.).

feature.name: Astrolabe Rupes
feature.origin: French; d'Urville's ship to explore Antarctica, 1838-40.

feature.name: Aurora
feature.origin: Albedo name for H-2, Victoria region.

feature.name: Australia
feature.origin: Albedo name for H-15, Bach region.

feature.name: Balanchine
feature.origin: George (Giorgi Balanchivadze); American choreographer of Georgian-Russian origin (1904-1983).

feature.name: Barney
feature.origin: Natalie Clifford; American-French playwright, poet, and novelist (1876-1972).

feature.name: Beagle Rupes
feature.origin: British; naval vessel aboard which Charles Darwin served as a naturalist on a surveying expedition, 1831-1836.

feature.name: Bechet
feature.origin: Sidney; American jazz musician and composer (1897-1959).

feature.name: Beethoven
feature.origin: Ludwig van; German composer of Flemish descent (1770-1827).

feature.name: Belgica Rupes
feature.origin: Belgian; ship used for an expedition to determine the position of the South Magnetic Pole in 1898, first ship to winter in Antarctica.

feature.name: Belinskij
feature.origin: Vissarion Grigoryevich; Russian literary critic and journalist (1811-1848).

feature.name: Bernini
feature.origin: Gian Lorenzo; Italian sculptor and architect (1598-1680).

feature.name: Blossom Rupes
feature.origin: English; ship used for an expedition to discover the Northwest Passage, 1825-1827.

feature.name: Boethius
feature.origin: Anicius Manlius Severinus; Roman scholar (c. A.D. 470-524).

feature.name: Borea
feature.origin: Albedo name for H-1, Borealis region.

feature.name: Borealis Planitia
feature.origin: "Northern plain"; from classical albedo name for quadrangle.

feature.name: Borobudur Fossae
feature.origin: A 9th-century Mahayana Buddhist temple in Magelang Regency, in Central Java, Indonesia, consisting of nine stacked platforms and topped by a central dome.

feature.name: Brontë
feature.origin: Charlotte (1816-1855), Emily (1818-1848), Anne (1820-1849); English novelists, and Branwell (1817-1848); author and painter.

feature.name: Bunin
feature.origin: Ivan, Russian author of prose and poetry; first Russian to win the Nobel Prize in Literature, in 1933. (1861 – 1941).

feature.name: Burke
feature.origin: Mary William Ethelbert Appleton “Billie”; American performing artist (1884-1970).

feature.name: Caduceata
feature.origin: Albedo name for H-3, Shakespeare region.

feature.name: Cahokia Vallis
feature.origin: Cahokia Mounds, ancient city in southern Illinois, USA.

feature.name: Caloris Montes
feature.origin: "Hot mountains"; surface temperature hottest near this position.

feature.name: Caloris Planitia
feature.origin: "Hot plain"; surface temperature hottest near this position.

feature.name: Calypso Rupes
feature.origin: French; originally commissioned in 1942 as a minesweeper, Calypso was purchased by Jacques-Yves Cousteau and used for oceanographic studies in 1950-1996.

feature.name: Caral Vallis
feature.origin: Ancient city in the Supe Valley, Peru.

feature.name: Carnegie Rupes
feature.origin: American; iron-free vessel used to conduct magnetic surveys from 1909 to 1928.

feature.name: Carolan
feature.origin: Turlough; Alternate spelling O’Carolan; Irish composer and performer (1670-1738).

feature.name: Castiglione
feature.origin: Giuseppe; Italian painter in the court of the Emperor of China (1688-1766).

feature.name: Catuilla Planum
feature.origin: Inca/Quechua word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Cervantes
feature.origin: Miguel de; Spanish novelist, playwright and poet (1547-1616).

feature.name: Chopin
feature.origin: Frederic; Polish-born French composer and pianist (1810-1849).

feature.name: Cyllene
feature.origin: Albedo name for unimaged H-14 region.

feature.name: de Graft
feature.origin: Joe; Ghanaian playwright, poet, and novelist (1924-1978).

feature.name: Discovery Rupes
feature.origin: English; Cook's ship on last voyage to Pacific, 1776-80.

feature.name: Disney
feature.origin: Walter Elias; American film director, screenwriter, and animator. (1901-1966).

feature.name: Dominici
feature.origin: (Suor) Maria de; Maltese sculptor and painter (1645-1703).

feature.name: Duyfken Rupes
feature.origin: Dutch; Willem Janszoon's ship credited with the first authenticated European discovery of Australia, 1606.

feature.name: Ellington
feature.origin: Edward Kennedy “Duke”; American composer, musician, conductor (1899-1974).

feature.name: Eltanin Rupes
feature.origin: American; oceanographic research vessel with an ice-breaking hull, collected magnetic profiles of the Antarctic sea floor, 1962.

feature.name: Endeavour Rupes
feature.origin: English; Cook's ship to explore Tahiti, New Zealand, Australia, 1768-71.

feature.name: Enheduanna
feature.origin: Sumerian poet, world’s first author known by name (2285 BCE to 2250 BCE).

feature.name: Enterprise Rupes
feature.origin: American; steamship that explored the Mississippi, Amazon, and Madeira Rivers and sailed on a worldwide hydrographic survey 1877 to 1886.

feature.name: Enwonwu
feature.origin: Benedict Chukwukadibia; Nigerian sculptor and painter (1921-1994).

feature.name: Equiano
feature.origin: O.; Olavdah, West Africa (Benin) slave, writer (c. 1750-1797).

feature.name: Erté
feature.origin: Romain de Tirtoff; French artist and designer of Russian origin (1892-1990).

feature.name: Fram Rupes
feature.origin: Norwegian; ship used in Arctic by Nansen, 1892-96, and by Sverdrup and Amundsen in Antarctica, 1909.

feature.name: Fuller
feature.origin: Richard Buckminster; American engineer and architect (1895-1983).

feature.name: Gata Facula
feature.origin: Fijian and Samoan word for snake.

feature.name: Gaudí
feature.origin: Antoni Gaudí i Cornet; Spanish Catalan architect (1852-1926).

feature.name: Geddes
feature.origin: Wilhelmina; Irish stained glass and graphic artist (1887-1955).

feature.name: Gibran
feature.origin: Kahlil (Khalil); Lebanese-American artist, poet, and writer (1883-1931).

feature.name: Gjöa Rupes
feature.origin: Norwegian; Amundsen's ship through Northwest passage, 1903-06.

feature.name: Goethe
feature.origin: Johann Wolfgang von; German poet and dramatist (1749-1832).

feature.name: Gordimer
feature.origin: Nadine (1923-2014), South African writer; recipient of the Nobel Prize in Literature (1991) and the Booker Prize (1974).

feature.name: Goya
feature.origin: Francisco (Jose) de Goy (y Lucientes); Spanish painter (1746-1828).

feature.name: Grifo Rupes
feature.origin: Portugese; ship used by D. João de Castro to make a survey of magnetic declination in the Atlantic and Indian Oceans in 1538.

feature.name: Hafiz
feature.origin: Hafiz (or Hafez) of Shiraz, Shams-ud-din Muhammad; Persian poet (c. 1320-1389).

feature.name: Heaney
feature.origin: Seamus Justin; Irish poet and playwright (1939 - 2013).

feature.name: Heemskerck Rupes
feature.origin: Dutch; one of Tasman's ships to explore Australia, New Zealand, 1642-43.

feature.name: Hero Rupes
feature.origin: American; Palmer's ship to explore Antarctic coast, 1820-21.

feature.name: Hokusai
feature.origin: Katsushika; Japanese painter, draftsman, and printmaker (1760-1849).

feature.name: Homer
feature.origin: Greek epic poet (8th or 9th century B.C.).

feature.name: Hugo
feature.origin: Victor; French writer, dramatist and poet (1802-1885).

feature.name: Ibsen
feature.origin: Heinrich J.; Norwegian poet and dramatist (1828-1906).

feature.name: Inyoka Faculae
feature.origin: Zulu and Xhosa (South Africa) word for snake.

feature.name: Jiménez
feature.origin: Juan Ramón, Spanish poet and author (1881 – 1958).

feature.name: Jobim
feature.origin: Antonio Carlos; Brazilian composer and musician (1927-1994).

feature.name: Judah Ha-Levi
feature.origin: Judah; Jewish poet and religious philosopher (c. 1075-1141).

feature.name: Kainan Rupēs
feature.origin: Japanese; Kainan Maru, ship of Nobu Shirase Antarctic exploration, 1910-1912.

feature.name: Karsh
feature.origin: Yousuf; Canadian portrait photographer of Armenian descent (1908-2002).

feature.name: Kuiper
feature.origin: Gerard P.; Dutch-American astronomer, member of original Mariner Venus-Mercury Imaging Team (1905-1973).

feature.name: Kulthum
feature.origin: Umm; Alternate spellings Kulthūm, Kalthoum, and Kalsoum; Egyptian singer (born between 1898 and 1904, died 1975).

feature.name: Kuniyoshi
feature.origin: Utagawa Kuniyoshi; Japanese painter and printmaker (1798-1861).

feature.name: La Dauphine Rupes
feature.origin: French; royal ship used for a voyage in search of the eastern coast of Asia, determined that North America was not an extension of Asia, 1524.

feature.name: Lennon
feature.origin: John Winston; English singer and songwriter (1940-1980).

feature.name: Leopardi
feature.origin: G.; Italian poet, scholar, and philosopher (1798-1837).

feature.name: Lessing
feature.origin: Gotthold Ephraim; German critic and dramatist (1729-1781).

feature.name: Liguria
feature.origin: Albedo name for unimaged H-4 region.

feature.name: Liszt
feature.origin: Franz; Hungarian piano virtuoso and composer (1811-1886).

feature.name: Lugus Planitia
feature.origin: Gaulish equivalent of the Roman god Mercury.

feature.name: Machaut
feature.origin: Guillaume de; French poet and composer (c. 1300-1377).

feature.name: Maciji Facula
feature.origin: Hausa (Niger and Nigeria) word for snake.

feature.name: March
feature.origin: Ausias; Spanish poet, first major poet to write in Catalan (1397-1459).

feature.name: Martí
feature.origin: Jose Julian Marti y Perez; Cuban poet and essayist (1853-1895).

feature.name: Mearcair Planitia
feature.origin: Irish word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Meteor Rupēs
feature.origin: German; expedition on Meteor ship explored the South Atlantic Ocean, 1925-1927.

feature.name: Michelangelo
feature.origin: Buonarroti; Italian painter, sculptor and architect (1475-1564).

feature.name: Mirni Rupes
feature.origin: Russian; Bellingshausen's ship for Antarctic exploration, 1819-21.

feature.name: Molière
feature.origin: Jean Baptiste Poquelin; French dramatist and satirist (1622-1673).

feature.name: Monk
feature.origin: Thelonious; American jazz musician and composer (1917-1982).

feature.name: Munch
feature.origin: Edvard; Norwegian painter, printmaker, and draftsman (1863-1944).

feature.name: Namatjira
feature.origin: Albert; Australian Aboriginal artist, pioneer of contemporary Indigenous Australian art (1902-1959).

feature.name: Nautilus Rupes
feature.origin: American; oceanic research and underwater archaeology vessel that performs studies in the Mediterranean and Caribbean since 2009.

feature.name: Nizāmī
feature.origin: Elyas Yusof Ganjavi; Persian epic poet (c. 1141-1209).

feature.name: Nureyev
feature.origin: Rudolf; Soviet and British ballet dancer of Tatar-Bashkir origin (1938-1993).

feature.name: Otaared Planitia
feature.origin: Arabic word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Ovid
feature.origin: Publius Ovidius Naso; Roman poet (43 B.C.-A.D. 17).

feature.name: Paestum Vallis
feature.origin: Ancient city in the Campania region of Italy.

feature.name: Palmer Rupes
feature.origin: American; ice-breaking ship dedicated to scientific research and operated by the National Science Foundation for Antarctic scientific missions since 1992.

feature.name: Pampu Facula
feature.origin: Tamil (SE India and NE Sri Lanka) word for snake. Another spelling is ‘pambu’.

feature.name: Pantheon Fossae
feature.origin: Classic domed Roman building begun in 27 BC by Marcus Agrippa, and rebuilt by Hadrian between AD 118 and 128.

feature.name: Paramour Rupes
feature.origin: English; research vessel of the Royal Navy used to study magnetism, longitude, and navigation problems, commanded by Edmond Halley from 1698 to 1699.

feature.name: Petipa
feature.origin: Marius; French and Russian choreographer and dancer (1818-1910).

feature.name: Phaethontias
feature.origin: Albedo name for H-8, Tolstoj region.

feature.name: Pieria
feature.origin: Albedo name for unimaged H-10 region.

feature.name: Poe
feature.origin: Edgar Allan; American poet, critic, editor and author (1809-1849).

feature.name: Pourquoi-Pas Rupes
feature.origin: French; Charcot's ship to explore Antarctica, 1908-10.

feature.name: Rachmaninoff
feature.origin: Sergei V.; Russian composer, pianist, and conductor (1873-1943).

feature.name: Raditladi
feature.origin: Leetile Disang; Botswanan playwright and poet (1910-1971).

feature.name: Rembrandt
feature.origin: Rembrandt Harmenszoon van Rijn; Dutch painter (1606-1669).

feature.name: Resolution Rupes
feature.origin: English; one of Cook's ships, second expedition to Pacific, 1772-75.

feature.name: Rikyū
feature.origin: Sen no; Japanese tea master, designer of Japanese tea ceremony (1522-1591).

feature.name: Rūmī
feature.origin: Jalal Ad-Din, also Mawlana; Persian poet and Sufi mystic (1207-1273).

feature.name: Sanai
feature.origin: Sanai of Ghazna, Abul Majd bin Majdud bin Adam; Persian poet (d. c. 1131).

feature.origin: Spanish; Columbus' flagship, first voyage to America, 1492.

feature.origin: Ines de la Cruz; Mexican writer (1651-1695).

feature.name: Sousa
feature.origin: John Philip; American bandmaster and composer (1854-1932).

feature.origin: Japanese; Japan’s first dedicated Antarctic research vessel (polar voyages in 1956-1962).

feature.name: Stilbon Planitia
feature.origin: Ancient Greek word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Strindberg
feature.origin: August; Swedish playwright, novelist, and short-story writer (1849-1912).

feature.name: Suisei Planitia
feature.origin: Japanese word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Sveinsdóttir
feature.origin: Júlíana; Icelandic painter and textile artist (1889-1966).

feature.name: Takanobu
feature.origin: Fujiwara; Japanese poet and portrait artist (1142-1205).

feature.name: Tansen
feature.origin: Indian (Mogul) composer from the court of Akbar.

feature.name: Terror Rupes
feature.origin: English; ship of discovery that took part in the Ross Antarctic expedition (1839-1843) and Franklin Arctic expedition (1845).

feature.name: Thākur
feature.origin: R.; Bengalese poet and novelist (also known as Tagore), Nobel Prize in literature in 1913 (1861-1941).

feature.name: Thoreau
feature.origin: Henry David; American poet and philosopher (1817-1862).

feature.name: Tir Planitia
feature.origin: Persian word for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Tolkien
feature.origin: John Ronald Reuel; English author and philologist (1892-1973).

feature.name: Travers
feature.origin: Pamela Lyndon (born Helen Lyndon Goff); Australian-born British writer best known for Mary Poppins series of children’s books (1899-1996).

feature.name: Tricrena
feature.origin: Albedo name for H-6, Kuiper region.

feature.name: Tsurayuki
feature.origin: Ki (Kino); noted Japanese man of letters (c. 945).

feature.name: Turms Planitia
feature.origin: Etruscan messenger god equivalent of Roman god Mercury.

feature.name: Unity Rupes
feature.origin: English vessel which took Edmond Halley to Saint Helena in 1676 to conduct a survey of the stars in the southern hemisphere. While there, Halley observed the 1677 transit of Mercury which enabled him to make one of the earliest calculations to estimate the size of the solar system.

feature.name: Utaridi Planitia
feature.origin: Swahili (E. Africa) name for the planet Mercury.

feature.name: Vālmiki
feature.origin: Sanskrit poet, author of the Ramayala (1st century B.C.).

feature.name: Victoria Rupes
feature.origin: Spanish; Magellan's and Del Cano's ship, first voyage around the world.

feature.name: Vostok Rupes
feature.origin: Russian; Bellingshausen's ship for Antarctic exploration, 1819-21.

feature.name: Yeats
feature.origin: William Butler; Irish poet and dramatist (1865-1939).

feature.name: Zarya Rupes
feature.origin: USSR; Motor-sail schooner to study Earth's magnetic field, 1953.

feature.name: Zeehaen Rupes
feature.origin: Dutch; one of Tasman's ships to explore Australia, New Zealand, 1642-43.
